alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 10:25PM EST until January 30 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Transylvania and Henderson Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...French Broad River at Blantyre. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Farmland flooding continues on both sides of the French Broad River. Floodwaters begin to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Rd. and Crab Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:16 PM EST Sunday the stage was 15.94 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 10.1 feet Friday evening. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1030 AM EST.
